member.name: M:K4AdotNet.BodyTracking.NativeApi.TrackerEnqueueCapture(K4AdotNet.NativeHandles.TrackerHandle,K4AdotNet.NativeHandles.CaptureHandle,K4AdotNet.Timeout)
member.summary: Add a Azure Kinect sensor capture to the tracker input queue to generate its body tracking result asynchronously.
member.param: Handle obtained by .
Handle to a sensor capture returned by from Sensor SDK. It should contain the depth data for this function to work. Otherwise the function will return failure.

Specifies the time the function should block waiting to add the sensor capture to the tracker process queue. is a check of the status without blocking. Passing will block indefinitely until the capture is added to the process queue.
member.returns: if a sensor capture is successfully added to the processing queue. If the queue is still full before the timeout elapses, the function will return . All other failures will return .
member.remarks:
Add a Azure Kinect capture to the tracker input queue so that it can be processed asynchronously to generate the body tracking result. The processed results will be added to an output queue maintained by instance. Call to get the result and pop it from the output queue. If the input queue or output queue is full, this function will block up until the timeout is reached.
Upon successfully insert a sensor capture to the input queue this function will return success.
This function returns when either the tracker is shut down by API, or an internal problem is encountered before adding to the input queue: such as low memory condition, not containing the depth data, or other unexpected issues.

member.name: M:K4AdotNet.BodyTracking.NativeApi.TrackerPopResult(K4AdotNet.NativeHandles.TrackerHandle,K4AdotNet.NativeHandles.BodyFrameHandle@,K4AdotNet.Timeout)
member.summary: Gets the next available body frame.
member.param: Handle obtained by .
If successful this contains a handle to a body frame object.
Specifies the time the function should block waiting for the body frame. is a check of the status without blocking. Passing will block indefinitely until the body frame becomes available.
member.returns: if a body frame is returned. If a body frame is not available before the timeout elapses, the function will return . All other failures will return .
member.remarks:
Retrieves the next available body frame result and pop it from the output queue in the . If a new body frame is not currently available, this function will block up until the timeout is reached. The SDK will buffer at least three body frames worth of data before stopping new capture being queued by .
Upon successfully reads a body frame this function will return success.
This function returns when either the tracker is shut down by API and the remaining tracker queue is empty, or an internal problem is encountered: such as low memory condition, or other unexpected issues.

member.name: M:K4AdotNet.BodyTracking.NativeApi.TrackerShutdown(K4AdotNet.NativeHandles.TrackerHandle)
member.summary: Shutdown the tracker so that no further capture can be added to the input queue.
member.param: Handle obtained by .
member.remarks:
Once the tracker is shutdown, API will always immediately return failure.
If there are remaining captures in the tracker queue after the tracker is shutdown, can still return successfully. Once the tracker queue is empty, the call will always immediately return failure.

member.summary: Get the body frame timestamp.

member.name: M:K4AdotNet.BodyTracking.NativeApi.FrameGetBodyIndexMap(K4AdotNet.NativeHandles.BodyFrameHandle)
member.summary: Get the body index map from .
member.param: Handle to a body frame object returned by function.
member.returns: Call this function to access the body index map image. Don't forget to call for returned handle after usage.
member.remarks:
Called when the user has received a body frame handle and wants to access the data contained in it.
Body Index map is the body instance segmentation map. Each pixel maps to the corresponding pixel in the depth image or the IR image. The value for each pixel represents which body the pixel belongs to. It can be either background (value 0xFF) or the index of a detected body.

member.name: T:K4AdotNet.BodyTracking.Tracker
member.summary: Body tracker. The main class in Body Tracking component.

remarks.para: Processing is organized as pipeline with queues. Use to add new capture to processing pipeline. Use to extract processed capture and body data from pipeline.

member.name: M:K4AdotNet.BodyTracking.Tracker.#ctor(K4AdotNet.Sensor.Calibration@)
member.summary: Creates a body tracker.
member.param: The sensor calibration that will be used for capture processing.

remarks.para: Under the hood Body Tracking runtime will be initialized during the first call of this constructor. It is rather time consuming operation: initialization of ONNX runtime, loading and parsing of neural network model, etc. For this reason, it is recommended to initialize Body Tracking runtime in advance: .

Also, Body Tracking runtime must be available in one of the following locations: directory with executable file, directory with K4AdotNet assembly, installation directory of Body Tracking SDK under Program Files.

member.exception: Invalid value of : cannot be and . Because depth data is required for body tracking.

Only one tracker is allowed to exist at the same time in each process. If you call this constructor without destroying the previous tracker you created, the constructor call will fail with this exception.

member.summary: Opens a new recording file for writing. The file will be created if it doesn't exist, or overwritten if an existing file is specified.

The Azure Kinect device that is being recorded. The device handle is used to store device calibration and serial number information. May be if recording user-generated data.
The configuration the Azure Kinect device was started with.
If successful, this contains a pointer to the new recording handle.
member.returns: is returned on success.
member.remarks:
Streaming does not need to be started on the device at the time this function is called, but when it is started it should be started with the same configuration provided in .
Subsequent calls to will need to have images in the resolution and format defined in .

member.summary: Writes a camera capture to file. Captures must be written in increasing order of timestamp, and the file's header must already be written.
member.param: The handle of recording, obtained by .
The handle of a capture to write to file.
member.returns: is returned on success.
member.remarks: This method will write all images in the capture to the corresponding tracks in the recording file. If any of the images fail to write, other images will still be written before a failure is returned.

member.name: M:K4AdotNet.Record.NativeApi.RecordWriteImuSample(K4AdotNet.NativeHandles.RecordHandle,K4AdotNet.Sensor.ImuSample)
member.summary: Writes an IMU sample to file.
member.param: The handle of recording, obtained by .
A structure containing the IMU sample data and time stamps.
member.returns: is returned on success.
member.remarks: Samples must be written in increasing order of timestamp, and the file's header must already be written. When writing IMU samples at the same time as captures, the samples should be within 1 second of the most recently written capture.

member.name: M:K4AdotNet.Record.NativeApi.RecordFlush(K4AdotNet.NativeHandles.RecordHandle)
member.summary: Flushes all pending recording data to disk.
member.param: The handle of recording, obtained by .
member.returns: is returned on success.
member.remarks:
This method ensures that all data passed to the recording API prior to calling flush is written to disk. If continuing to write recording data, care must be taken to ensure no new time stamps are added from before the flush.
If an error occurs, best effort is made to flush as much data to disk as possible, but the integrity of the file is not guaranteed.

member.param: Handle obtained by .
Location to write the calibration data to. This field may optionally be set to if the caller wants to query for the needed data size.
On passing into the function this variable represents the available size to write the raw data to. On return this variable is updated with the amount of data actually written to the buffer.
member.returns: if was successfully written. If points to a buffer size that is too small to hold the output, is returned and is updated to contain the minimum buffer size needed to capture the calibration data.
member.remarks: The raw calibration may not exist if the device was not specified during recording.

member.name: M:K4AdotNet.Record.NativeApi.PlaybackSetColorConversion(K4AdotNet.NativeHandles.PlaybackHandle,K4AdotNet.Sensor.ImageFormat)
member.summary: Set the image format that color captures will be converted to. By default the conversion format will be the same as the image format stored in the recording file, and no conversion will occur.
member.param: Handle obtained by .
The target image format to be returned in captures.
member.returns: if the format conversion is supported. otherwise.
member.remarks:
After the color conversion format is set, all objects returned from the playback handle will have their color images converted to the .
Color format conversion occurs in the user-thread, so setting to anything other than the format stored in the file may significantly increase the latency of and .

member.name: M:K4AdotNet.Record.NativeApi.PlaybackGetNextCapture(K4AdotNet.NativeHandles.PlaybackHandle,K4AdotNet.NativeHandles.CaptureHandle@)
member.summary: Read the next capture in the recording sequence.
member.param: Handle obtained by .
If successful this contains a handle to a capture object.
member.returns: if a capture is returned, or if the end of the recording is reached. All other failures will return .
member.remarks:
This method always returns the next capture in sequence after the most recently returned capture.
The first call to this method after will return the capture in the recording closest to the seek time with an image timestamp greater than or equal to the seek time.
If a call was made to that returned , the playback position is at the beginning of the stream and this method will return the first capture in the recording.
Capture objects returned by the playback API will always contain at least one image, but may have images missing if frames were dropped in the original recording. When calling , , or , the image should be checked for .

member.name: M:K4AdotNet.Record.NativeApi.PlaybackGetPreviousCapture(K4AdotNet.NativeHandles.PlaybackHandle,K4AdotNet.NativeHandles.CaptureHandle@)
member.summary: Read the previous capture in the recording sequence.
member.param: Handle obtained by .
If successful this contains a handle to a capture object.
member.returns: if a capture is returned, or if the start of the recording is reached. All other failures will return .
member.remarks:
This method always returns the previous capture in sequence before the most recently returned capture.
The first call to this method after will return the capture in the recording closest to the seek time with all image time stamps less than the seek time.
If a call was made to that returned , the playback position is at the end of the stream and this method will return the last capture in the recording.
Capture objects returned by the playback API will always contain at least one image, but may have images missing if frames were dropped in the original recording. When calling , , or , the image should be checked for .

member.name: M:K4AdotNet.Sensor.Calibration.Convert2DTo2D(K4AdotNet.Float2,System.Single,K4AdotNet.Sensor.CalibrationGeometry,K4AdotNet.Sensor.CalibrationGeometry)
member.summary: Transform a 2D pixel coordinate with an associated depth value of the source camera into a 2D pixel coordinate of the target camera.
member.param: The 2D pixel in coordinates.
The depth of in millimeters.
The current camera.
The target camera.
member.returns: The 2D pixel in coordinates or if does not map to a valid 2D coordinate in the coordinate system.

remarks.para: This function maps a pixel between the coordinate systems of the depth and color cameras. It is equivalent to calling to compute the 3D point corresponding to and then using to map the 3D point into the coordinate system of the .
If and are identical, the function immediately returns value of parameter and doesn't compute any transformations.

member.exception: is not a camera or is not a camera.
Cannot perform transformation. Most likely, calibration data is invalid.

member.name: M:K4AdotNet.Sensor.Calibration.Convert2DTo3D(K4AdotNet.Float2,System.Single,K4AdotNet.Sensor.CalibrationGeometry,K4AdotNet.Sensor.CalibrationGeometry)
member.summary: Transform a 2D pixel coordinate with an associated depth value of the source camera into a 3D point of the target coordinate system.
member.param: The 2D pixel in coordinates.
The depth of in millimeters.
The current camera.
The target camera or IMU sensor.
member.returns: 3D coordinates of the input pixel in the coordinate system of in millimeters or if the results are outside of the range of valid calibration.
member.remarks: This function applies the intrinsic calibration of to compute the 3D ray from the focal point of the camera through pixel .The 3D point on this ray is then found using . If is different from , the 3D point is transformed to using . In practice, and will often be identical. In this case, no 3D to 3D transformation is applied.
member.exception: is not a camera.
Cannot perform transformation. Most likely, calibration data is invalid.

member.name: M:K4AdotNet.Sensor.Calibration.Convert3DTo2D(K4AdotNet.Float3,K4AdotNet.Sensor.CalibrationGeometry,K4AdotNet.Sensor.CalibrationGeometry)
member.summary: Transform a 3D point of a source coordinate system into a 2D pixel coordinate of the target camera.
member.param: The 3D coordinates in millimeters representing a point in .
The current camera or IMU sensor.
The target camera.
member.returns: The 2D pixel in coordinates or if the results are outside of the range of valid calibration.
member.remarks: If is different from , is transformed to using . In practice, and will often be identical. In this case, no 3D to 3D transformation is applied. The 3D point in the coordinate system of is then projected onto the image plane using the intrinsic calibration of .
member.exception: is not a camera.
Cannot perform transformation. Most likely, calibration data is invalid.

member.name: M:K4AdotNet.Sensor.Calibration.Convert3DTo3D(K4AdotNet.Float3,K4AdotNet.Sensor.CalibrationGeometry,K4AdotNet.Sensor.CalibrationGeometry)
member.summary: Transform a 3D point of a source coordinate system into a 3D point of the target coordinate system.
member.param: The 3D coordinates in millimeters representing a point in .
The current coordinate system of camera or IMU sensor.
The target coordinate system of camera or IMU sensor.
member.returns: The new 3D coordinates of the input point in the coordinate space in millimeters.
member.remarks: This function is used to transform 3D points between depth and color camera coordinate systems. The function uses the extrinsic camera calibration. It computes the output via multiplication with a precomputed matrix encoding a 3D rotation and a 3D translation. If and are the same, then result will be identical to .
member.exception: Cannot perform transformation. Most likely, calibration data is invalid.

member.name: T:K4AdotNet.Sensor.Capture
member.summary: A capture represents a set of images that were captured by a Azure Kinect device at approximately the same time.

remarks.para: A capture may have a color, IR, and depth image.A capture may have up to one image of each type. A capture may have no image for a given type as well.
Captures also store a temperature value which represents the temperature of the device at the time of the capture.

While all the images associated with the capture were collected at approximately the same time, each image has an individual timestamp which may differ from each other. If the device was configured to capture depth and color images separated by a delay, and will return a capture containing both image types separated by the configured delay.

member.exception: Sensor DK fails to create empty capture object for some reason. For details see logs.

member.name: M:K4AdotNet.Sensor.Capture.Dispose
member.summary: Call this method to free unmanaged resources associated with current instance.

remarks.para: Under the hood, reference counter is decremented on this call. When the references reach zero the unmanaged resources are destroyed. (Multiple objects of can reference one and the same capture. For details see .)
Can be called multiple times but event will be raised only once.

member.name: P:K4AdotNet.Sensor.Capture.ColorImage
member.summary: Get and set the color image associated with the given capture. Can be if the capture doesn't have color data.

remarks.para: For this reason, if you want to keep returned for longer life time than life time of object, use method.
The capture will add a reference on any that is added to it with this setter. If an existing image is being replaced, the previous image will have the reference released.

member.exception: This property cannot be called for disposed objects.

member.remarks: Control values set on a device are reset only when the device is power cycled. The device will retain the settings even if the device is closed or the application is restarted.

member.summary: Exposure time setting.
member.remarks: May be set to or . Exposure time is measured in microseconds. For details see: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/Kinect-dk/hardware-specification#rgb-camera-exposure-time-values

member.name: F:K4AdotNet.Sensor.ColorControlCommand.AutoExposurePriority
member.summary: Exposure or Frame rate priority setting.
member.remarks: May only be set to . Value of 0 means frame rate priority. Value of 1 means exposure priority. Using exposure priority may impact the frame rate of both the color and depth cameras. Deprecated starting in 1.1.0. Please discontinue usage, firmware does not support this.

remarks.para: The streaming of individual sensors stops as a result of this call. Once called, may be called again to resume sensor streaming.

member.exception: This method cannot be called for disposed object.

IMU streaming is already running or cameras streaming is not running.

member.summary: Image format to capture with the color camera.

Use only s that is applicable for color images. To check it you can call .

member.summary: Image resolution to capture with the color camera.
member.remarks:
Not all combinations of , and are supported. To check compatibility use
and .

member.name: F:K4AdotNet.Sensor.DeviceConfiguration.DepthMode
member.summary: Capture mode for the depth camera.
member.remarks: To check compatibility of with use .

member.name: F:K4AdotNet.Sensor.DeviceConfiguration.CameraFps
member.summary: Desired frame rate for the color and depth camera.
member.remarks: cannot be used with and . Use and to check compatibility.

member.name: F:K4AdotNet.Sensor.DeviceConfiguration.SynchronizedImagesOnly
member.summary: Only produce capture objects if they contain synchronized color and depth images.

remarks.para: This setting controls the behavior in which images are dropped when images are produced faster than they can be read, or if there are errors in reading images from the device.
If set to , capture objects will only be produced with both color and depth images. If set to , capture objects may be produced only a single image when the corresponding image is dropped.
Setting this to ensures that the caller receives all of the images received from the camera, regardless of whether the corresponding images expected in the capture are available.
If either the color or depth camera are disabled, this setting has no effect.

member.name: F:K4AdotNet.Sensor.DeviceConfiguration.DepthDelayOffColor
member.summary: Desired delay between the capture of the color image and the capture of the depth image.
member.remarks: A negative value indicates that the depth image should be captured before the color image. Any value between negative and positive one capture period is valid.

member.name: F:K4AdotNet.Sensor.DeviceConfiguration.WiredSyncMode
member.summary: The external synchronization mode.

member.name: F:K4AdotNet.Sensor.DeviceConfiguration.SubordinateDelayOffMaster
member.summary: The external synchronization timing.

remarks.para: If this camera is a subordinate, this sets the capture delay between the color camera capture and the external input pulse. A setting of zero indicates that the master and subordinate color images should be aligned.
This setting does not effect the 'Sync out' connection.
This value must be positive and range from zero to one capture period.
If this is not a subordinate, then this value is ignored.

member.name: F:K4AdotNet.Sensor.DeviceConfiguration.DisableStreamingIndicator
member.summary: Streaming indicator automatically turns on when the color or depth camera's are in use.
member.remarks: This setting disables that behavior and keeps the LED in an off state.

member.name: T:K4AdotNet.Sensor.ImageFormat
member.summary: Image format type.
member.remarks: Helpful extension methods for this enumeration type can be found in .

member.name: F:K4AdotNet.Sensor.ImageFormat.ColorMjpg
member.summary: The buffer for each image is encoded as a JPEG and can be decoded by a JPEG decoder.
member.remarks: Because the image is compressed, the stride parameter is not applicable. Each MJPG encoded image in a stream may be of differing size depending on the compression efficiency.

member.name: F:K4AdotNet.Sensor.ImageFormat.ColorNV12
member.summary: NV12 images separate the luminance and chroma data such that all the luminance is at the beginning of the buffer, and the chroma lines follow immediately after.
member.remarks: Stride indicates the length of each line in bytes and should be used to determine the start location of each line of the image in memory. Chroma has half as many lines of height and half the width in pixels of the luminance. Each chroma line has the same width in bytes as a luminance line.

member.name: F:K4AdotNet.Sensor.ImageFormat.ColorYUY2
member.summary: YUY2 stores chroma and luminance data in interleaved pixels.
member.remarks: Stride indicates the length of each line in bytes and should be used to determine the start location of each line of the image in memory.

member.name: F:K4AdotNet.Sensor.ImageFormat.ColorBgra32
member.summary: Each pixel of BGRA32 data is four bytes. The first three bytes represent Blue, Green, and Red data. The fourth byte is the alpha channel and is unused in the Azure Kinect APIs.
member.remarks:
Stride indicates the length of each line in bytes and should be used to determine the start location of each line of the image in memory.
The Azure Kinect device does not natively capture in this format. Requesting images of this format requires additional computation in the API.

member.name: F:K4AdotNet.Sensor.ImageFormat.Depth16
member.summary: Each pixel of DEPTH16 data is two bytes of little endian unsigned depth data. The unit of the data is in millimeters from the origin of the camera.
member.remarks: Stride indicates the length of each line in bytes and should be used to determine the start location of each line of the image in memory.

member.name: F:K4AdotNet.Sensor.ImageFormat.IR16
member.summary: This format represents infrared light and is captured by the depth camera. Each pixel of IR16 data is two bytes of little endian unsigned depth data. The value of the data represents brightness.
member.remarks: Stride indicates the length of each line in bytes and should be used to determine the start location of each line of the image in memory.

member.name: F:K4AdotNet.Sensor.ImageFormat.Custom
member.summary: Custom image format. Used in conjunction with user created images or images packing non-standard data.
member.remarks: See the originator of the custom formatted image for information on how to interpret the data.

member.name: T:K4AdotNet.Sensor.WiredSyncMode
member.summary: Synchronization mode when connecting two or more devices together.

member.name: F:K4AdotNet.Sensor.WiredSyncMode.Standalone
member.summary: Neither 'Sync In' or 'Sync Out' connections are used.

member.name: F:K4AdotNet.Sensor.WiredSyncMode.Master
member.summary: The 'Sync Out' jack is enabled and synchronization data it driven out the connected wire.

member.name: F:K4AdotNet.Sensor.WiredSyncMode.Subordinate
member.summary: The 'Sync In' jack is used for synchronization and 'Sync Out' is driven for the next device in the chain. 'Sync Out' is a mirror of 'Sync In' for this mode.
